alert.note: Alert for Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 10:53AM CDT until further notice by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Wisconsin River below Biron Reservoir affecting Wood County. ...The National Weather Service in Green Bay WI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Wisconsin River below Stevens Point affecting Portage County. Wisconsin River below Whiting Dam affecting Portage County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Wisconsin River below Biron Reservoir. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1020.5 feet, Up to 2 feet of water surrounds some homes on South Biron Drive in Biron. Portions of Reddin Road are likely closed. Portions of Highway 66 or County Road P near the Stoney Brook Creek bridge are covered with water and may be closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:10 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 1020.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:10 AM CDT Thursday was 1020.4 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 1017.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 1020.7 feet on 09/25/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
